posts.author: HipRedux
posts.content:
Well, you don't have to focus in a weapon, but the longsword focus will help your Tenser.  Any other weapon focus is just pure spellsword-ish, though.

IMO, the potential of at least Div Shield is worth the investment in pally, not to mention being able to Taunt opposed spellcasters.  The Div Might is more geared towards the polymorph's damage.  I mean, it's hanging there and you have to take at least 3 pally levels (a PW preventing Pal 1 cheese), so why not glean something from the investment of those extra levels?  It's also handy to have a late discipline dump vs. a caster's nemesis... KD. Anyway, that's how I'd assess the value.  I understand they have mucked about with dispelling on Arelith so that Mords have been nerfed but IIRC abjuration makes the other dispels very nasty... or something like that.  The Tenser Transformation is never safe, but a dispelled sorc still has plenty of IGMS to dish out when it happens.

As to your former topic... yes, you deleted it.  By accident of course, but it is still dead as a doorknob and floating into the mist by now.  Noone else but you and the admin can delete your posts and, like I said, I know I didn't. The remedy:

Whenever you try to revise the lead post (or any reply, for that matter), ALWAYS click the Preview screen.  If the editor screen comes up blank... CANCEL!  Then try again starting from scratch.  Never click Post if the editor screen is blank.  Why is this happening?  Probably some latency in the synch between the server that houses the editor and the server that provides the forum itself.  Dunno, but it happens occasionally.

If the same issue becomes chronic, PM me.  I'll explain in detail how to change the format of your editor so that never happens again.  It's not as cutesy an editor view as the default one, but will never erase all your text (and/or images) again.  It's the format I have been using after getting exasperated with the exact issue you just experienced.  There's little that screws up the forums worse than evaporating contributions.  Even relentless spam isn't as annoying to readers.  So be on guard in the future, please.

posts.author: HipRedux
posts.content:
Okay, first off I almost never play a sorc because their main benefit is the synergy for saves and access to Taunt and other pally skill dumps and I prefer the wiz/rog synergy along with all the extra spellcasting feats.  The boost from Div Shield makes a major difference.  But that means you really only need 4 pally, 3 to get Turn Undead/Div Shield, then a last one as late as possible is for both defense (anti-KD mostly) and a way to harass mages' via spell failure plus extra AB for your Tenser.  The main reason you see 6 pally in the example is to get regular skill dumps instead a single late cheesy one, the Div Might bonus and slightly better BAB (12 instead of 11 but 3 APR in both cases).   But that was for a spellsword so you don't want to invest in any weapon feats unless you plan to boost your Tenser.  Not a bad idea, especially when facing raks (immune to all spells Level 8 or lower) or highly-resistent types like dragons and some skels.  Bosses will usually have a similar omnipotence bestowed upon them to deflect magical attacks.   But many other base creatures can get modified with immunities and resistances that thwart even the highest level pure spellcaster, arcane or divine.

So, depending on how many unmanageable situations you are preparing to overcome will determine how much you will fortify your Tenser with weapon feats.  A heavily-focused Tenser will make most spellswords look ridiculous because of the AB boost it gets from many caster levels.  Naturally, the downside is getting dispelled so a spellsword can work okay as long as they get a weapon with a high enchantment to make up for the puny BAB.

I'd ignore Epic Prowess but keep Armor Skin.  If you can fit it in, Epic Concentration is also worth it.

Take your CHA as high as possible, STR 13 and the rest to CON.   If you get gifts, put them all in CHA or CON.  Each 2 points is another +1AC , +1 univ DC and more spells/day (plus boosts to Taunt & other CHA skills).  Ideally, you'd fit all the spell pen feats in.  For PvP... absolutely, for PvM... not quite as important but still helps, especially in pre-epic before you've piled up lots of sorc levels.

I'll try to rejuggle the spellsword into more of a pure caster in the next few days if no one else has.  In the meantime, check around your server wiki or forums to decide the best school focus.  I'm sure there are some more exploitable than others and it's up to you to make that determination.

Now, to kinda roll off topic for my own knowledge. What sort of benefits to wizards gain by taking rogue levels? (Besides, tumble, and trap related skills.) How much do you figure they lose in return?

CLASS CHANGES - SORCERER/WIZARD

Sorcerers and Wizards now gain innate abilities that can be cast infinitely when selecting a greater spell focus. These abilities are as follows:
* GSF Abjuration grants Endure Elements.
* GSF Conjuration grants Melf's Acid Arrow.
* GSF Divination grants See Invisibility.
* GSF Enchantment grants Blindness/Deafness.
* GSF Evocation grants Magic Missile.
* GSF Illusion grants Color Spray.
* GSF Necromancy grants Ray of Enfeeblement. (Changed from Negative energy ray.)
* GSF Transmutation grants Burning Hands.
(Note: More spells will be added to this list in the future.)

posts.author: HipRedux
posts.content:
Rienion wrote:
Now, to kinda roll off topic for my own knowledge. What sort of benefits to wizards gain by taking rogue levels? (Besides, tumble, and trap related skills.) How much do you figure they lose in return?
Monk gear and divine scrolls/wands via UMD, Uncanny Dodge and Evasion.  All my wizzers are serious trappers to conserve their spells/day and kill spell immune/resistant types easily.  Usually they have decent lock skills to avoid clogging up slots with Knock spells.  Pixie is awesome for backcasting ImpInv but cannot recover traps, even while possessed.  The occasional sneak damage for the polymorphs also doesn't hurt.  I like gnomes.  Vs. pure wiz version, they'll lose a bit of penetration and spell duration but not enough to matter.

There's also a more defensive dexer Epic Dodge Wiz 27/Rog 13 or Wiz24/Rog16 design as a master thievery version.  So many wiz bonus feats make it quite feasible.  The polymorphs get ridiculous sneak damage while exploiting Darkness.  Now, back to our regularly-scheduled program...
